results.title: Natasha Lyonne Is a Boss (a Boss Trying to Stop Time)
results.abstract: Amid Oscar talk for her quiet turn in “His Three Daughters” on Netflix, the spitfire star has become a force as a producer driven by a sense of mortality.

results.title: Sophie Died in 2021. The Album She Left Behind Is Now Complete.

results.title: Nelson DeMille, Blockbuster Author Who Thrilled Millions, Dies at 81
results.abstract: In best seller after best seller, world-weary investigators tackled military malfeasance and Russian spies, cracking jokes and beers to the delight of legions of devoted fans.

multimedia.caption: Mr. DeMille in 2005 at his home in Garden City, N.Y. His book-lined office, which he called Area 51, was filled with the scent of Marlboro cigarettes, black coffee and pencil shavings.
multimedia.copyright: Katrina Hajagos for The New York Times

results.title: On an Italian Island, a Home That Celebrates Color and Craft
results.abstract: Atop the volcanic cliffs on the tranquil Salina, one woman has created a respite where art and nature reside in perfect harmony.
results.byline: By Nancy Hass and Diego Mayon

multimedia.caption: In Cecilia Morelli’s compound on the Aeolian island of Salina, the walls of her daughter, Gaia’s, playroom were hand-painted by Pictalab — a group of Milanese artisans who visited the home for two weeks to decorate many of its surfaces — in a scallop pattern meant to evoke waves. The toile sconces are from G Lab in Milan, and the carpet is from Jaipur Rugs.

In Cecilia Morelli’s compound on the Aeolian island of Salina, the walls of her daughter, Gaia’s, playroom were hand-painted by Pictalab — a group of Milanese artisans who visited the home for two weeks to decorate many of its surfaces — in a scallop pattern meant to evoke waves. The toile sconces are from G Lab in Milan, and the carpet is from Jaipur Rugs.

The toile sconces are from G Lab in Milan, and the carpet is from Jaipur Rugs.

results.title: New York Philharmonic Players Reach Deal Raising Base Pay to $205,000
results.abstract: Under a new labor agreement, expected to be ratified Friday, the musicians will get a 30 percent raise over three years, making them among the highest paid in the country.

results.title: Mark Podwal, Prolific Artist of Jewish Themes, Dies at 79
results.abstract: His art included cartoons for The New York Times, collaborations with Elie Wiesel and images that traced the history of antisemitism. He was also a dermatologist.

multimedia.caption: Mark Podwal in 2007. A physician by training, he chose dermatology as his specialty because it gave him time to pursue his art, which grappled with themes of Jewish identity.
Mark Podwal in 2007. A physician by training, he chose dermatology as his specialty because it gave him time to pursue his art, which grappled with themes of Jewish identity.

results.title: The Frick Collection Looks to London For Next Leader
results.abstract: Axel Rüger, the head of the Royal Academy of Arts, will replace Ian Wardropper next spring as the museum’s director.

multimedia.caption: “It’s an exciting time to reopen, develop exciting programs for loyal visitors, and welcome new audiences,” said Axel Rüger, next leader of the Frick.

results.title: Lucine Amara, 99, Dies; Familiar Soprano at the Met Saw Bias There
